column2: No. Key Responsibilities: Service   1 Will work under the supervision of Director /   Consultant. Will not ordinarily have independent privileges     Help Director / Consultants in conducting OPD and   other clinical activities as specified and as per privileges granted     Conduct free OPDs under supervision of Consultants as   per the privileging and hospital policy as defined from time to time     Support Consultants in conducting specialty clinics   such as Allergy clinics as per privileges     Assist in Bronchoscopy & chest related pleural   tapping, insertion of ICDs and other clinical procedures as per the assigned   clinical privileges     Collate and analyze records, reports, test results,   or examination information to diagnose disease of the patient     Prescribe or administer medication, therapy, and   other specialized comprehensive medical care to treat / prevent / limit   illness, disease, or injury under consultation of primary consultants.  Identify patients risk status and recommend   appropriate intervention to minimize risk under consultation of primary   consultants.      Explain procedures, obtain consents   and discuss test results or prescribed treatments with guardian and family     Supervise PFT Technicians and   review their PFT reports for final submission to the treating consultant and   patients     Monitor patients' conditions and   progress and reevaluate treatments as necessary and discuss the same with the   treating Consultant. Refer patient to other specialist as and when required   after due intimation and explanation to guardian / family as advised by the   treating consultant     Conduct regular ward rounds and   works at a time that facilitates efficient patient flow and meets treatment objectives   to maintain continuity of patient care covering the wards, Floors, EMS and   Outreach clinics     Maintain and update documentation in Hospital Information   System with respect to assigned clinical responsibilities including patient   history, clinical assessment, prescriptions, medications, progress notes,   investigations, discharge notes and any other medical records     Maintain clinical documentation   including initial assessment, progress notes and HOTO notes on a daily basis     Ensure accurate exchange of   information during care transition and transfer of patients ensuring that   patient privacy and confidentiality is duly protected at all the times   1 Promote use of evidence based practice to   ensure patient safety      Prepare and release discharge summaries as   advised by primary consultant     Work   collaboratively with other disciplines and health professionals to develop   effective and appropriate multidisciplinary treatment plans for patients     Cover   ward duties and attend to on call emergency care on need basis and as per   departmental rota     Comply with CME   credits as per MMC guidelines in vogue     Participate in interdepartmental meetings,   committees and perform all the responsibilities as assigned     Participate as per the defined role during   any internal / external disaster      Ensure   the following activities are completed with respect to discharge process: Provisional   Discharge: a. Confirmation of discharge by Consultants b. Confirmation and clearance of investigations   done on the day of the discharge c. Removal of all lines and tubes in   coordination with Nursing team Mark for   Discharge: a. Completion of discharge summary     Any other   responsibility as assigned by the organization on the need basis   Key Responsibilities:   Growth   1 Participate in health programs in the hospital,   outreach activities, or communities for prevention and treatment of injuries   or illnesses.   Key   Responsibilities: Quality     Ensure clinical care and infection   control quality indicators are within the defined bench mark     Actively participate and be accountable   for implementation of all quality programs to ensure continuous quality   improvement in the department     Ensure adherence to internationally   accepted standards of care, including but not limited to those recommended by   JCI, NABH and other quality systems     Follow all infection control protocols during all stages   of clinical care     Actively participate in infection control and   prevention activities, campaigns, awareness sessions etc.   Key Responsibilities : Finance     Ensure   optimum utilization of departmental resources   Key Responsibilities : People     Be available to cover colleague when they are sick /   on leave (within the constraints of existing workload)     Ensure adequate coverage ensuring   hand-over of responsibilities prior to proceeding on leaves     Train the new   joinees on the departmental policies, SOPs and protocols     Be a mentor and   guide the junior medical staff and DNB students on the departmental   activities and processes   Key Responsibilities : Innovation &   Research     Participate   in clinical education, research, test medication, clinical tests to advance   the practice of pulmonology medicine as well as academic and teaching activities of as required by   the DNB or any teaching programs.     Actively give   suggestions / feedback to further improvise services of department and growth   of the department     Participate in the research activities of the   department 3. Competencies    Competencies   A. Core HNH Values   Patient First   Excellence    Accountability    Respect   Teamwork   Integrity   B. Function-specific Competencies (Technical   /Functional)   Knowledge of   departmental policies and procedures   Aptitude   towards, teaching, publication and research   Knowledge about   Infection prevention and control   Knowledge about   JCI & NABH standards

column2: SRI Balaji Hospital is looking for ICU Intensivist to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey        ?       Education    - MBBS with ICU Experience                  ?       Nature of Duty :    Critical Care Management                  ?       Required Candidate profile          UG : MBBS or equivalent per MCI rules      PG : MD or equivalent      Post PG : any          Tasks            Patient Care    : Provide comprehensive medical care to critically ill patients in the intensive care unit (ICU), including those with severe respiratory, cardiac, neurological, or multi-organ dysfunction.        Monitoring and Assessment    : Monitor patients' vital signs, oxygenation, cardiac rhythm, and other physiological parameters using advanced monitoring equipment. Conduct frequent assessments and clinical examinations to evaluate patients' condition and response to treatment.        Diagnostic and Therapeutic Interventions:    Order and interpret diagnostic tests, including laboratory tests, imaging studies, and invasive procedures such as arterial lines, central venous catheters, and ventilator management.        Ventilator Management    : Manage mechanical ventilation for patients requiring respiratory support, including setting ventilator parameters, optimizing oxygenation, and managing ventilator-induced lung injury.        Hemodynamic Support    : Provide hemodynamic support to patients with shock or circulatory failure, including fluid resuscitation, vasopressor therapy, and inotropic support.        Nutritional Support    : Assess nutritional status and requirements of critically ill patients and implement appropriate enteral or parenteral nutrition support strategies.        Medication Management    : Prescribe and manage pharmacological therapies, including sedatives, analgesics, vasoactive agents, antimicrobials, and other medications used in the ICU setting.        Multidisciplinary Collaboration    : Collaborate with other members of the healthcare team, including nurses, respiratory therapists, pharmacists, and consultants from various specialties, to optimize patient care and outcomes.        Communication and Education    : Communicate effectively with patients, families, and caregivers, providing clear explanations of medical conditions, treatment options, and prognosis. Participate in patient and family education initiatives to promote understanding and engagement in care.

column2: The candidate must have extensive knowledge in the domain of Pulmonology. She/He must demonstrate high degree of responsibility towards patient care. Looking for DNB degree  or MD in Pulomonology/ Pulmonary Medicine with 0-2 years experience.

Consulting with patients to understand their symptoms and health concerns     Diagnosing and treating conditions, such as asthma, bronchitis, and emphysema     Using and interpreting pulmonological exams and tests to aid in the diagnosis of cardiopulmonary diseases and conditions, including CT scans, chest fluoroscopies, ultrasounds, and bronchoscopies     Performing various specialized procedures in order to acquire samples of the chest wall lining or the lungs, for further analysis     Providing immunizations against preventable cardiopulmonary diseases     Maintaining detailed notes of appointments with patients, including comments, tests and/or treatments prescribed, and test results     Referring patients to cardiothoracic surgeons, when necessary     Advising cardiothoracic surgeons of the risk status of patients and recommending interventions to minimize risk, especially in tuberculosis cases     Providing support and advice to patients receiving long-term care     Conducting research into the testing and development of new medications and methods of treatment
